# NSView.Invalidations.Tuple

**Structure**

A change that invalidates a combination of factors covered by the other invalidation types.

## Declaration

```swift
struct Tuple<Invalidation1, Invalidation2> where Invalidation1 : NSViewInvalidating, Invalidation2 : NSViewInvalidating
```

## Overview

The system uses this type when a change invalidates multiple aspects of a view. Use a tuple of the static values defined in [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSViewInvalidating] when more than one invalidation type applies to a change.

## Creating the invalidation type

- **init(_:_:)**: Creates the invalidation type.

## Invalidating the view

- **invalidate(view:)**: Indicates to the system that an aspect of a view is invalid and triggers the necessary update.

## Types of Invalidations

- **NSView.Invalidations.Constraints**: A change that invalidates a view’s constraints.
- **NSView.Invalidations.Display**: A change that requires the system to redraw a view’s content.
- **NSView.Invalidations.IntrinsicContentSize**: A change that invalidates a view’s intrinsic size.
- **NSView.Invalidations.Layout**: A change that invalidates the layout of the containing view’s subviews.
- **NSView.Invalidations.RestorableState**: A change that invalidates the restorable state of the view.

## Conforms To

- NSViewInvalidating
